Test Description: Assessing ability to optimally plan over multiple steps of domino selection and placement
Difficulty Notes: This example intentionally has no player interaction as green player is uninterrupted. Other challenging versions may include player interaction. Note: the current player being green is inferred from the text in the game state
Question: What next domino should the player select to maximize the score of their kingdom? Assume the game ends after placement of the pictured dominos. Output the following: Domino letter, 'Previous kingdom score', eventual 'New kingdom score' after placement of all of the shown/selected draftable dominos.
Answer: Domino: H, Previous kingdom score: 2, New kingdom score: 9
Rationale: Green player selected a double grasslands domino in the prior round. We can pair this with the existing grasslands on the left side of their kingdom. By selecting domino H, we can add a crown to this section, improving its scoring from 0x4 to 1x7
